title.narrative: INCREASED KNOWLEDGE FOR INFORMED DECISIONS MAKING

description.narrative: By 2023, adolescent girls and boys have increased knowledge to make informed decisions, which contributes to Cross Sectoral - Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more adolescent girls and boys participate in their communities and utilize services adapted to their needs while the resilience of their communities is strengthened in target areas

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, adolescent girls and boys have increased knowledge to make informed decisions

description.narrative: Some 177,260 adolescents (75,199 girls; 99,443 boys) in 10 provinces benefited from greater employability prospects thanks to new skills and competencies and access to social and financial assets. Of these, 5,940 adolescents (2,900 girls; 3,040 boys)accessed additional resources to reinforce their creativitythanks to the fiveinnovation labs established in three provinces. The commitment of the Government to scale up the skills-building programme for adolescents at the national level was demonstrated by its leadership in setting up the Generation Unlimited partnership. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022
